    • Field Detail

      • TYPE_MESSAGE

        public static final java.lang.String TYPE_MESSAGE
        TYPE constant for messages

        It is recommended to use this constant to tell the API that you want to send a message. If this constant changes your application automatically will use the new constant.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TYPE_URL

        public static final java.lang.String TYPE_URL
        TYPE constant for URLs

        It is recommended to use this constant to tell the API that you want to send a message. If this constant changes your application automatically will use the new constant.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • instanceByCredentials

        public static PushNotifier instanceByCredentials(java.lang.String username,
                                 java.lang.String apiKey)
                                          throws InvalidTokenException,
                                                 LimitExceededException,
                                                 InternalFailureException,
                                                 java.io.IOException,
                                                 LoginFailedException
        Create instance by using a user's credentials.

        This method tries to log in a user by its GIDIX account credentials (either username + password or username + apiKey). If successful a new instance of PushNotifier is returned.

        Parameters:
        username -
        apiKey - / password
        Returns:
        A PushNotifier object
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Standard Java IOException
        InternalFailureException - If someting's gone wrong internally (please tell us if you found a bug!).
        LimitExceededException - If you exceeded your API limit.
        InvalidTokenException - If either the appToken or apiToken is invalid.
        LoginFailedException - If the user could not be logged in.

      • instanceByToken

        public static PushNotifier instanceByToken(java.lang.String username,
                           java.lang.String token)
                                    throws InvalidTokenException,
                                           LimitExceededException,
                                           InternalFailureException,
                                           java.io.IOException,
                                           LoginFailedException
        Create instance by using a user's token.

        This method assumes the token provided is correct. It returns a new instance of PushNotifier.

        Parameters:
        username -
        token -
        Returns:
        A PushNotifier object
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Standard Java IOException
        InternalFailureException - If someting's gone wrong internally (please tell us if you found a bug!).
        LimitExceededException - If you exceeded your API limit.
        InvalidTokenException - If either the appToken or apiToken is invalid.
        LoginFailedException - If the user could not be logged in.

      • getDevices

        public Device[] getDevices()
                    throws InvalidTokenException,
                           LimitExceededException,
                           InternalFailureException,
                           java.io.IOException
        Get a list of all devices of a user.

        Returns an array full of Device objects.

        Returns:
        Array of devices
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Standard Java IOException
        InternalFailureException - If someting's gone wrong internally (please tell us on GitHub if you found a bug!).
        LimitExceededException - If you exceeded your API limit.
        InvalidTokenException - If either the appToken or apiToken is invalid.

      • sendToDevice

        public void sendToDevice(java.lang.String content,
                java.lang.String type,
                Device[] devices)
                  throws InvalidTokenException,
                         LimitExceededException,
                         InternalFailureException,
                         java.io.IOException,
                         PushFailedException
        Send something to a user's device.

        Sends something of PushNotifier.TYPE_MESSAGE or PushNotifier.TYPE_URL to an array of Devices.

        Parameters:
        content -
        type -
        devices -
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Standard Java IOException
        InternalFailureException - If someting's gone wrong internally (please tell us on GitHub if you found a bug!).
        LimitExceededException - If you exceeded your API limit.
        InvalidTokenException - If either the appToken or apiToken is invalid.
        PushFailedException - If at least one push was not successful.
